alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Jefferson, southern Shawnee, northwestern Douglas, east central Wabaunsee and northeastern Osage Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 515 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Grantville to 5 miles north of Carbondale to 4 miles southeast of Alma. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Topeka, Tecumseh, Richland, Dover, Auburn, Perry, Lecompton, Keene, Pauline, Berryton, Williamstown and Grantville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 336 and 339. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 166 and 195. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
